info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 1 at 4:44AM AKDT until October 3 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Moderate snowfall expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 9 inches possible. Higher accumulations expected at higher elevations.
* WHERE...Areas along the Steese Highway, up to around mile marker 90, and the higher elevations of the White Mountains.
* WHEN...From 2 PM Thursday to 10 PM AKDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A weaker system out ahead of the main storm will move over the area Wednesday night into Thursday. The heaviest snowfall will be with the main storm, that will move over the area Thursday night into Friday morning.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THURSDAY TO 10 PM AKDT FRIDAY

area.areaDesc: White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Chatanika River Valley
